alert.note: Alert for Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 04 at 11:10AM MST until January 06 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM MST THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow and significant blowing snow are possible. Total snow accumulations of 15 to 25 inches are possible with isolated higher amounts to around 30 inches in the Teton Range. Winds could gust as high as 60 mph. * WHERE...Salt River and Wyoming Ranges and Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains. * WHEN...From 11 PM MST this evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Visibility could be down to a tenth of a mile at times. People recreating in the backcountry could become disoriented. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Please monitor JHAVALANCHE.ORG for the avalanche risk across western Wyoming.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains
